field.name: WAKEUP
field.description: Low Leakage Wakeup Reset\n Indicates a reset has been caused by an enabled wakeup source while the chip was in a low leakage mode. Any enabled wakeup source in a VLLSx mode causes a reset. This bit is cleared by any reset except WAKEUP

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by wakeup source

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by wakeup source

field.name: LVD
field.description: Low-Voltage Detect Reset\n If PMC_LVDSC1[LVDRE] is set and the supply drops below the LVD trip voltage, an LVD reset occurs. This field is also set by POR

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by LVD trip or POR

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by LVD trip or POR

field.name: LOC
field.description: Loss-of-Clock Reset\n Indicates a reset has been caused by a loss of external clock. The MCG clock monitor must be enabled for a loss of clock to be detected. Refer to the detailed MCG description for information on enabling the clock monitor

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by a loss of external clock

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by a loss of external clock

field.name: LOL
field.description: Loss-of-Lock Reset\n Indicates a reset has been caused by a loss of lock in the MCG PLL. See the MCG description for information on the loss-of-clock event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by a loss of lock in the PLL

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by a loss of lock in the PLL

field.name: WDOG
field.description: Watchdog\n Indicates a reset has been caused by the watchdog timer timing out. This reset source can be blocked by disabling the watchdog

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by watchdog timeout

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by watchdog timeout

field.name: PIN
field.description: External Reset Pin\n Indicates a reset has been caused by an active-low level on the external RESET pin

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by external reset pin

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by external reset pin

field.name: POR
field.description: Power-On Reset\n Indicates a reset has been caused by the power-on detection logic. Because the internal supply voltage was ramping up at the time, the low-voltage reset (LVD) status bit is also set to indicate that the reset occurred while the internal supply was below the LVD threshold

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by POR

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by POR

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by JTAG

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by JTAG

field.name: LOCKUP
field.description: Core Lockup\n Indicates a reset has been caused by the ARM core indication of a LOCKUP event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by core LOCKUP event

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by core LOCKUP event

field.name: SW
field.description: Software\n Indicates a reset has been caused by software setting of SYSRESETREQ bit in Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register in the ARM core

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by software setting of SYSRESETREQ bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by software setting of SYSRESETREQ bit

field.name: MDM_AP
field.description: MDM-AP System Reset Request\n Indicates a reset has been caused by the host debugger system setting of the System Reset Request bit in the MDM-AP Control Register

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by host debugger system setting of the System Reset Request bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by host debugger system setting of the System Reset Request bit

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by EzPort receiving the RESET command while the device is in EzPort mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by EzPort receiving the RESET command while the device is in EzPort mode

field.name: SACKERR
field.description: Stop Mode Acknowledge Error Reset\n Indicates that after an attempt to enter Stop mode, a reset has been caused by a failure of one or more peripherals to acknowledge within approximately one second to enter stop mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by peripheral failure to acknowledge attempt to enter stop mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by peripheral failure to acknowledge attempt to enter stop mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Reset not caused by tamper detect

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Reset caused by tamper detect

field.name: RSTFLTSRW
field.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Run and Wait Modes\n Selects how the reset pin filter is enabled in run and wait modes

enumeratedValue.name: 0b00
enumeratedValue.description: All filtering disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b01
enumeratedValue.description: Bus clock filter enabled for normal operation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b10
enumeratedValue.description: LPO clock filter enabled for normal operation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b11
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

field.name: RSTFLTSS
field.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Stop Mode\n Selects how the reset pin filter is enabled in Stop and VLPS modes, and also during LLS and VLLS modes. On exit from VLLS mode, this bit should be reconfigured before clearing PMC_REGSC[ACKISO]

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: All filtering disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: LPO clock filter enabled

field.name: RSTFLTSEL
field.description: Reset Pin Filter Bus Clock Select Selects the reset pin bus clock filter width (0-32 bus clocks)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Pin negated (logic 1)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Pin asserted (logic 0)
